channel.title: Help with commands? Rep++
channel.description: Ok so I have a hybrid pvp v3 source and in the commands.java file is all the commands. So I look in it and I don't see any if player rights = 1 , and all that. How would I add it so that mods + could use that command. I see nothing? I uploaded the file if you want to look yourself. Example: the command ::item. If i want that to be mod + how would I do that. I don't see it at all

item.title: Help with commands? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @99rangek0 99rangek0
item.description:
@99rangek0 wrote:

Camballer:

Hah, I just realized that… Sorry. How would I make item a Mod+ command?

If its like my server mod commands are under this line of code :

Edit
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I checked your file.
Your mod commands are located under the line of command
[code]    public void moderatorCommands(Client c, String playerCommand)[/code]

Simply add any mod+ commands you want below that line.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with commands? Rep++

item.title: Help with commands? Rep++
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

If you read this nice little piece of code here it should deduce the obvious

if (c.playerRights >= 0) playerCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) moderatorCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 2 || c.playerRights == 3) administratorCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 3) ownerCommands(c, playerCommand); if (c.playerRights == 4) DonatorCommands(c, playerCommand); }

You will see that there are specific voids for each player rights commands i.e:
the item command would go under

[tt]public void administratorCommands(c, String)[/tt] or [tt]public void ownerCommands(c, String) {[/tt]
It’s all really a matter of placing the commands under the right void method.

Read full topic
